revised_title: Observations of the Total Solar Eclipse of January 22, 1898, at Ghoglee, Central Provinces
tldr: The author describes the preparations and observations made during the total solar eclipse of January 22, 1898, at Ghoglee in the Central Provinces of India. The observations were conducted using various instruments, including a horizontal telescope, a prismatic camera, and a spectroscope. The author provides details on the equipment, methods, and results of the observations.
